name: Weighted Step-ups
how_to_perform:
1. Stand in front of a set of stairs or bench with your right foot on the platform and your left foot on the ground. Hold a weight in each hand.

2. Slowly lift your left foot onto the platform, keeping your knee behind your toes.

3. Push through your heel to straighten your left leg and stand up, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.

4. Step back down to the starting position with your right foot first, keeping your core engaged throughout the exercise.

5. Alternate legs for the desired number of repetitions, changing sides after each repetition.

6. When performing step-ups on a flat surface (such as a platform or bench), it's essential to use proper form and keep your knees behind your toes at all times. Use a weight that allows you to maintain control throughout the exercise.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on slow and controlled movements.
short_summary: Weighted step-ups are an explosive lower body exercise that effectively targets multiple muscle groups
